name: Boston's on the Beach
address: 40 S Ocean Blvd, Delray Beach, FL 33483
description: A Delray Beach landmark right on the ocean. Boston's has been the go-to spot for live music, cold drinks, and watching the game with your feet practically in the sand. Two floors, rooftop bar, and a vibe that gets louder as the night goes on.

name: Tin Roof
address: 8 E Atlantic Ave, Delray Beach, FL 33444
description: Nashville-born live music bar planted right on Atlantic Ave. Tin Roof brings national touring acts, local bands, and DJs seven nights a week. The food is solid, the drinks are strong, and the energy stays high from happy hour to last call.

name: The Office Delray
address: 201 E Atlantic Ave, Delray Beach, FL 33444
description: Tell your boss you're at The Office and you won't be lying. A sleek gastropub on Atlantic with great trivia nights, game day watch parties, and a happy hour that draws the after-work crowd. Upscale enough to impress, casual enough to stay all night.

name: Johnnie Brown's
address: 301 E Atlantic Ave, Delray Beach, FL 33483
description: Old-school Delray bar with pool tables, live music, and zero pretension. Johnnie Brown's has been holding it down on Atlantic Ave for years. Cheap drinks, loud bands, and the kind of place where everyone knows at least one person.

name: Dada
address: 52 N Swinton Ave, Delray Beach, FL 33444
description: A hidden gem tucked behind a garden courtyard. Dada is part art gallery, part live music venue, part comedy club. The intimate stage hosts everything from jazz to spoken word. If you want something different from the typical Atlantic Ave scene, this is it.

name: Honey
address: 16 E Atlantic Ave, Delray Beach, FL 33444
description: Delray's answer to the nightclub question. Honey brings bottle service, top-tier DJs, and a dance floor that fills up fast on weekends. Sleek interior, strong drinks, and a crowd that came to move.

name: Saltwater Brewery
address: 1701 W Atlantic Ave, Delray Beach, FL 33444
description: Laid-back craft brewery with a big outdoor space, food trucks, and the kind of chill vibe where dogs are welcome and flip-flops are the dress code. Live music on weekends, trivia during the week, and some of the best local beer in South Florida.

name: Hurricane Bar & Lounge
address: 640 E Atlantic Ave, Delray Beach, FL 33483
description: A no-frills neighborhood bar with karaoke, cheap drinks, and regulars who'll buy you a round. Hurricane is the kind of dive bar that every town needs. Come as you are.

name: Tim Finnegans Irish Pub
address: 2885 S Federal Hwy, Delray Beach, FL 33483
description: Proper Irish pub with dark wood, Guinness on tap, and live Celtic music that makes you forget you're in Florida. Trivia nights pack the place, and the happy hour pours are generous. A Delray staple.

name: Deck 84
address: 840 E Atlantic Ave, Delray Beach, FL 33483
description: Waterfront dining with a view of the Intracoastal that's hard to beat. Deck 84 is where you go for sunset cocktails, date nights, and a menu that punches above your average bar food. Dress up a little.

name: Cut 432
address: 432 E Atlantic Ave, Delray Beach, FL 33483
description: Upscale steakhouse and bar on Atlantic Ave with craft cocktails, a killer happy hour, and the kind of atmosphere that says "treat yourself." Great for date night or celebrating something worth celebrating.

name: Brule Bistro
address: 200 NE 2nd Ave, Ste 109, Delray Beach, FL 33444
description: French-inspired bistro with a wine list that goes deep and a happy hour that goes easy on the wallet. Intimate space, excellent food, and the kind of place you bring someone you're trying to impress.

name: Park Tavern
address: 32 SE 2nd Ave, Delray Beach, FL 33444
description: Neighborhood bar done right. Park Tavern has pool tables, craft cocktails, solid trivia nights, and a patio that's perfect for low-key hangs. Not trying to be fancy, just trying to be good.

name: Delray Beach Yoga
address: 29 SE 5th Ave, Delray Beach, FL 33483
description: The go-to yoga spot right off Atlantic Ave. They have classes for every level and the instructors actually remember your name. Great way to start the morning before hitting the beach.

name: Delray Municipal Beach
address: 100 S Ocean Blvd, Delray Beach, FL 33483
description: The volleyball courts here get serious on weekends. Pickup games start around 9am and go all day. The water is usually crystal clear and there's always someone renting paddleboards nearby.

name: Wakodahatchee Wetlands
address: 13026 Jog Rd, Delray Beach, FL 33446
description: This place is an absolute gem. A three-quarter mile boardwalk through constructed wetlands with herons, turtles, and gators just doing their thing. Go early morning for the best bird activity. Completely free.

name: Morikami Museum & Japanese Gardens
address: 4000 Morikami Park Rd, Delray Beach, FL 33446
description: Honestly one of the most peaceful places in all of South Florida. The gardens are beautiful for a slow walk, and the museum rotates solid exhibits. The bonsai collection alone is worth the trip.

name: Delray Beach GreenMarket
address: 20 W Atlantic Ave, Delray Beach, FL 33444
description: Every Saturday morning from October through May, Old School Square turns into the best farmers market in Palm Beach County. Fresh produce, local honey, juices, and baked goods. Bring the dog, everyone does.

name: Sandoway Discovery Center
address: 142 S Ocean Blvd, Delray Beach, FL 33483
description: A little nature center right on the beach with shark feedings, reef tanks, and a butterfly garden. Kids go crazy for the shark feeding at 10:30am on Tuesdays. Small but totally worth a visit.

name: Island Water Sports
address: 1985 NE 2nd Ave, Delray Beach, FL 33444
description: Been around forever and still the spot for paddleboard and kayak rentals in Delray. They do SUP lessons too if you've never been. Staff is super chill and knows the Intracoastal like the back of their hand.

name: Pineapple Grove Arts District
address: NE 2nd Ave & NE 1st St, Delray Beach, FL 33444
description: The artsy heart of downtown Delray. Murals everywhere, galleries you can pop into, and some great spots to grab coffee and people-watch. The monthly art walk brings the whole neighborhood out.

name: Veterans Park
address: 802 NE 1st St, Delray Beach, FL 33483
description: Right on the Intracoastal with playgrounds, a rec center, and open green space. Run clubs meet here, families come for the playground, and the sunset views over the water are legit.

name: Atlantic Dunes Park
address: 1605 S Ocean Blvd, Delray Beach, FL 33483
description: Way less crowded than the main beach and honestly more beautiful. There's a boardwalk through the dunes and the beach is wide and clean. Perfect for a quiet morning walk or a low-key beach day.

name: Anchor Park
address: 340 S Ocean Blvd, Delray Beach, FL 33483
description: A nice little park right at the south end of the public beach. Good playground for kids, metered parking, and easy beach access. Less hectic than trying to park right on Atlantic.

name: Old School Square
address: 51 N Swinton Ave, Delray Beach, FL 33444
description: The cultural hub of downtown Delray. They host outdoor concerts, movie nights, yoga on the lawn, and seasonal festivals. The pavilion and green space make it a perfect gathering spot year-round.

name: Death or Glory
address: 116 NE 6th Ave, Delray Beach, FL 33483
description: Their weekend brunch is seriously underrated. Beautiful old house turned into a cocktail bar with an amazing garden patio. The brunch cocktails and food menu are both top tier. Get there early on Sundays.

name: Sande
address: 100 E Atlantic Ave, Delray Beach, FL 33444
description: Right on Atlantic Ave with a great breakfast and lunch menu. The avocado toast is actually good and the coffee is strong. Perfect people-watching spot on a Saturday morning.
